column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Not Feel Alone in Your Opinion
#Text=Have you ever felt like you have an opinion on something , but nobody else seems to agree with you ?
#Text=Do you feel alienated and unconfident as a result of this ?
#Text=A few simple tips should help !
#Text=Steps
#Text=Analyze your opinion .
#Text=How and why did you form this opinion , why do you feel so strongly about it , and why do you feel alienated for having it ?
#Text=This first step is important , because once you pinpoint exactly why your opinion is so important to you , it may become easier for you to learn how to deal with your problem .
#Text=Think of the number of people in the world .
#Text=There are well over 7 billion people on the planet , and it is very unlikely that your opinion on something is unique .
#Text=It is almost certain that there is at least one other person alive today that shares your opinion .
#Text=Go onto Google and type in how you feel about something .
#Text=To make for a better search , only use the most important keywords .
#Text=You should hopefully find at least one website which features an opinion piece submitted by someone that matches yours .
#Text=If you find a lot of websites like this , this can mean an excellent boost of self-confidence for you , as you may realise that you were not as alone as you thought you were .
#Text=From here , you can do extra research on the topic you have an opinion about .
#Text=Read as many websites as you can in order for you to understand and possibly accept each side to the argument , as well as the history and development of the opinion topic .
#Text=Make an opinion collage .
#Text=This involves taking screenshots of the opinions you find online on things and pasting them into a Microsoft Paint document .

#Text=It can be very handy to have an archive of paragraphs that you agree with , because when you feel alone once again , you can always view your opinion collage to remind yourself that there are people out there that agree with you .
#Text=Alternatively , you can add webpages featuring opinions you agree with , to your favourites for quick reference .
#Text=Join a website , such as a forum , based upon the topic you have an opinion of ( i.e. music , television , religion , politics ) .
#Text=Here , you can start a thread where you can discuss your opinion and why you feel strongly about it .
#Text=Hopefully , you will find that there are people who feel the same way and agree .
#Text=And if no-one agrees , it is still good to give your viewpoint regardless .
#Text=If it is unique , it may interest and fascinate people .
#Text=Smile with satisfaction .
#Text=It always feels good to know that there are others out there who feel the same way you do about something important to you , and this can be very reassuring .
#Text=Tips
#Text=Remember that it is good to have an unpopular opinion .
#Text=It is all too easy to jump on the bandwagon and let others choose your opinion for you , so feel proud to have a viewpoint that differs from the norm .
#Text=It shows you have an analytical mind .
#Text=When making an opinion collage , make sure to only crop the most important parts of what you find .
#Text=That way , reading and referring to it becomes a lot easier .
#Text=Do not feel like your opinion on something is wrong if you find no one else who agrees with you .
#Text=Your opinion is your opinion , and that is all that matters in the end .
#Text=You should not let an opinion define you as a person or make you feel inferior for having it .
#Text=If you post your opinion on something online and someone responds negatively to it , do not argue with that person .
#Text=Arguing on the Internet is a waste of time , and could cost you a bad reputation .
